medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue, rash, fevers, anemia, and thrombocytopenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed over a 2-week period prior to admission. The patient experienced fatigue, weakness, dyspnea on exertion, fevers with the highest temperature of 38.3°C, and night sweats. Generalized weakness and episodes of palpitations occurred. A rash appeared on the posterior aspect of the right knee, along with bruising on both arms. One day before admission, an episode of weakness with tunnel vision occurred without loss of consciousness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes alcohol-use disorder, peptic ulcer disease, Barrett’s esophagus, and anxiety. Three years prior, the patient had a motor vehicle accident that led to a large hematoma and subsequent thrombocytopenia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had diabetes; father had hypertension. No family history of hematologic cancer was mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: Patient resides on an island in New England and works as a restaurant cook. He reported occasional binge drinking but had not consumed alcohol in the 2 weeks prior to admission. No history of smoking, illicit drug use, or herbal medication use was noted. The patient noted frequent tick exposure.
